page.title: 20GHOSTS
page.content: GAWSWORTH GHOSTS. EXTRACTS FROM "Cheshire Village Memories." W.I.books 1953. "A former sexton, Mr. Holland used to say he often saw the ghost of Mary Fytton.There would be a rustling of silk and a low sigh and from behind the altar Mary dressed in a green riding habit would apppear.She would glide down the chancel and then disappear into the vestry. The church would go very cold." "He also told of meeting the ghost of Maggoty Johnson.One moonlight night he met a man on a white charger who turned off the road into "Maggoty Wood",Mr. Holland followed and arrived at Maggoty's grave just in time to hear the stone go bump." Typed by Mr. Jones.Teacher Class 4.
